code: import amyris from"./Images/amyris-oil.png";import bergamot from"./Images/bergamot.png";import citron from"./Images/citron1.png";import clarysage from"./Images/clarysage.png";import frangipani from"./Images/frangipani.png";import frankincense from"./Images/frankincense.png";import heliotrope from"./Images/heliotrope.png";import jasmine from"./Images/jasmine.png";import labdanum from"./Images/rockrose.png";var plants=[{id:"1",img:amyris,name:"Amyris",desc:"Amyris is a genus of flowering plants in the citrus family,Rutaceae. The generic name is derived from the Greek word αμυρων (amyron), which means 'intensely scented' and refers to the strong odor of the resin. Members of the genus are commonly known as Torchwoods because of their highly flammable wood."},{id:"2",img:bergamot,name:"Bergamot",desc:"Bergamot, one of several fragrant herbs of the genus Monarda (family Lamiaceae) or the fruit of the bergamot orange (Citrus ×aurantium). The bergamot herbs and the bergamot orange have a similar characteristic floral fragrance and are commonly used in perfumes and as a flavouring."},{id:"3",img:citron,name:"Citron",desc:"The citron (Citrus medica) is a large fragrant citrus fruit with a thick rind. It is one of the three original citrus fruits from which all other citrus types have developed.  It is used widely in Asian cuisine, and also in traditional medicines, perfume.Lemons and many limes come from hybridization."},{id:"4",img:clarysage,name:"Clary Sage",desc:"Salvia sclarea, the clary or clary sage, is a biennial or short-lived herbaceous perennial in the genus Salvia. It is native to the northern Mediterranean Basin, along with some areas in north Africa and Central Asia. The plant has a lengthy history as an herb, and is currently grown for its essential oil."},{id:"5",img:frangipani,name:"Frangipani",desc:"Plumeria is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. Most species are deciduous shrubs or small trees. The species variously are endemic to Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean, and as far south as Brazil and north as Florida, but are grown as cosmopolitan ornamentals in warm regions."},{id:"6",img:frankincense,name:"Frankincense",desc:"There are five main species of Boswellia that produce true frankincense. Resin from each of the five is available in various grades, which depend on the time of harvesting. The resin is hand-sorted for quality."},{id:"7",img:heliotrope,name:"Heliotrope",desc:"Heliotropium is a genus of flowering plants in the borage family, Boraginaceae. There are around 325 species in this cosmopolitan genus.Its delicious scent, oscillates between marzipan, vanilla, cherry pie and almond. It is highly toxic for dogs and cats."},{id:"8",img:jasmine,name:"Jasmine",desc:"Jasmine is a genus of shrubs and vines in the olive family. It contains around 200 species native to tropical and warm temperate regions of Eurasia and Oceania. Jasmines are widely cultivated for the characteristic fragrance of their flowers."},{id:"9",img:labdanum,name:"Labdanum",desc:"Labdanum is a sticky brown resin obtained from the shrubs Cistus ladanifer and Cistus creticus, species of rockrose. It is used in the preparation of some perfumes and vermouths."}];export default plants;
